qas.question: What year did sub-saharan Africa have the highest rates of child labour?
What is the largest employer of child labour?
Who are children predominantly employed by?
Lack of school and this are the primary causes of child labour

context: In developing countries, with high poverty and poor schooling opportunities, child labour is still prevalent. In <a0_0>2010<a0_0/>, sub-saharan Africa had the highest incidence rates of child labour, with several African nations witnessing over 50 percent of children aged 5–14 working. Worldwide <a1_0>agriculture<a1_0/> is the largest employer of child labour. Vast majority of child labour is found in rural settings and informal urban economy; children are predominantly employed by <a2_0>their parents<a2_0/>, rather than factories. <a3_0>Poverty<a3_0/> and lack of schools are considered as the primary cause of child labour.
